content: hey friends today I'm going to do a video on painting miniatures today I'm
gonna paint a large miniature from the shadows of brimstone game and I just
want to mention that I've had a lot of people ask me about this I've kind of
resisted doing miniatures painting videos because there's a lot already out
there but I feel that I could bring something to it my style is kind of I
call it tape already so I'm not painting it down to the last teeny teeny detail
you know with a brush you know every single crevice on something increase but
it still looks good why I feel that my miniatures have a nice paint job and I'm
proud of what I paint but I don't obsess over just the micro details so if if
you're looking for paint adventure to a good standard but you're not wanting to
spend you know so much time on one miniature then this might be the
technique for you so let's hit the table and I'll show you how I start painting
first I'm going to show you my setup for painting I've got some paper towels you
need these to wipe your brushes off and I've got this pad that I like to paint
on I just put the pad down and when I finish painting I just throw the sheet
away so it's kind of a nice thing to do I have a just a plastic tub of water
another throw away plastic tub that I can mix paints in you'll see that a lot
off-screen but I've got different brushes very small brush you want a very
kind of small brush for miniature painting and then a wider brush for
doing larger areas and I'm going to have really soft brushes for doing dry
brushes and you can see how soft those bristles are and those really give you a
nice dry brush alright so there's kind of the tools set up now I've got some
paints these aren't necessarily paints I'm using but I just use cheap craft
acrylic paints I don't buy the expensive miniature painting and I think I get
really good results with just the cheap paint and what I do is I shake up the
paint take the lid off the paint and just dip out of the top of the bottle
like a you know like a pilot type thing so then I'm done
just put the lid back on no muss no fuss I don't have to pour the pain out and
waste it so that's a nice little trick you can do so here's my model my Goliath
model he's all spray-painted flat black and I've got a medium green here I'm not
gonna necessarily give the names of the colors I'm just gonna say what type of
color and what I'm doing is I'm washing the body okay and I get I think it gives
a nice effect to do this so that's why I'm doing it and it'll definitely dry
darker than it looks okay so I'm just covering the whole body you don't worry
about if you get it on the base of the manager I do have it upside down so it
won't get on the base of the miniature as much but if it does don't worry about
it and I'm not paying the tentacles in the front either just the body itself so
I'm washing it down what's some areas that are a little too wet you can add a
little more color to them so there we go and he's dried up and see it's a nice
color on there and I really like that dark greenish
color there and I'm gonna use the such eerie red and I'm gonna use that for the
tentacles so the nasty tentacles popping out of the mouth so just paint those up
same thing using the wet paint very wet area like this technique
there we go filling all the tentacles make sure you get all the cracks and
crevices there nice all right now I'm going to do the arms okay there's
underside to the arms that have suction cups and I'm going to paint the other
side the same way so the trick is to get it wet enough to fill in all the
crevices but not too wet that'll run along the arm it'll run out of the area
you're painting okay so there we go nice gory red there like that all right we'll
let them dry up now what we're gonna do is we're gonna take our red again and
I'm gonna put a little dot in the ear there's like kind of an ear hole and I'm
just gonna kind of poke that in the ear you guys see a little better from this
angle there we go all right now I'll just let him dry up
and now I have a pinkish color and kind of like a raspberry and I'm going to use
it on the tackles to try and kind of dry brush to kind of make them pop out and
I'm using that soft brush and I'm just rubbing it over the surface I'm not
trying to cover the whole thing because I want the cherry red to kind of peek
through especially at the edges where they kind of bunch up so just put that
on there looking good and I'm pretty much doing this
full-strength I'm not really watering this down like I did with the other
paints alright that's looking good good nasty
all right cool all right now I've got a lighter green that I'm going to use and
I'm gonna start dry brushing with this brush here I'm going to start pulling up
on the head especially around the maw and the body and you can see all that
detail really starting to pop out now this looks a lot brighter than it'll be
when it dries keep that in mind with this paint it's always gonna look a bit
brighter before it dries okay so make sure you get the edge you don't want to
get the tentacle suction-cup area there you just want to get the backside of the
arm looking good just pull that up get all that detail yeah look at that detail
really starting to pop out with those two different colors you can really see
all the detail now and that's what the dry brushing can do for you
see if the top is already starting to dry up and it's not as bright cover the
whole body nice alright now I've got a very light pink it's lighter than the
raspberry and I'm just gonna use full strength and I'm gonna dry brush this on
the the suction cups under the arm see how those are popping out look really
good and I didn't paint those individually I just run the dry brush
over that raised area and get that nice detail this pops right out do the same
thing with the face tentacles kind of the tips though I'm not gonna do to the
end I'm just going to kind of give a color variation of the tentacle itself
so kind of nice nice and creepy all right sweet now I'm going to use a
white and I'm gonna pick out the teeth with my very thin brush that's at that
teeny brush I had showed the beginning there and I'm just gonna pick out the
individual teeth so I'll just start very carefully around that Maw and pick out
these teeth now make sure to catch part two of this video so you can see how I
finish this guy up and let's finish up these teeth nice we'll do the other side
hey crap France I hope you enjoyed this episode of the crafts if you didn't make
sure to get your Scottie alike also make sure to join my Facebook and form group
lovely bunch of people with some great great ideas and we'd love to share with
everybody also make sure to consider tipping DM Scotty if you really enjoy
these videos and you get something out of them and you want to help help a DM
out you can do the tip jar also my patreon group is growing and become a
member of the family I have about new levels of pledging three dollar level
you'll get mentioned in the video dollar level you get my new monthly magazine
which is going to be so awesome packed full of fun DM Scotty ideas and last but
not least go forth and crafts
